name: Tom Yum Kung
description: A classic Thai soup known for its bold and spicy flavors, made with succulent shrimp and infused with aromatic herbs like lemongrass and kaffir lime leaves. This soup offers a delightful balance of heat and sourness.
steps: In a pot, bring water to a boil.
Add lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves to the pot.
Simmer for about 5 minutes to infuse the flavors.
Add the shrimp and cook until they turn pink.
Stir in fish sauce and lime juice to taste.
Add sliced chili peppers for heat.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs.

name: Kimchi
description: A traditional Korean side dish made from fermented Napa cabbage, seasoned with chili powder, garlic, and ginger. Packed with probiotics, it is a tangy and spicy dish that varies in flavor, making it a versatile addition to any meal.
steps: Cut Napa cabbage into quarters and remove the core.
Salt the cabbage and let it sit for 2 hours.
Rinse and drain the cabbage well.
In a bowl, mix chili powder, minced garlic, ginger, fish sauce, and scallions.
Coat the cabbage with the spice mixture evenly.
Pack the cabbage tightly into a jar and seal it.
Let it ferment at room temperature for 24 hours before refrigerating.

name: Papaya Salad
description: Known as Som Tum in Thailand, this vibrant dish combines shredded green papaya with spicy chili, fresh lime juice, and a dash of fish sauce, topped with crunchy peanuts for a refreshing and zesty flavor.
steps: Peel and shred the papaya into thin strips.
Chop chili peppers and garlic finely.
In a bowl, combine shredded papaya, chili peppers, and garlic.
Add lime juice and fish sauce, mixing well.
Top with crushed peanuts before serving.
Serve chilled as a refreshing salad.

name: Cabbage with Chili
description: A simple yet flavorful dish that combines tender cabbage with spicy chili sauce and garlic. Quick to prepare, it serves as a great side dish or light main course.
steps: Slice cabbage into thin strips.
Heat oil in a pan and add minced garlic.
Add cabbage to the pan and stir-fry for a few minutes.
Pour in chili sauce and fish sauce, mixing well.
Cook until the cabbage is tender but still crisp.
Serve hot as a side dish.

name: Tofu and Seaweed Soup
description: A comforting soup featuring soft tofu and nutrient-rich seaweed, combined with a hint of chili flakes for spice. Perfect as a light meal or starter.
steps: Bring water to a boil in a pot.
Add seaweed and let it cook for a few minutes.
Cut tofu into cubes and add to the pot.
Stir in chili flakes and soy sauce for flavor.
Add sliced ginger for extra aroma.
Simmer for another 5 minutes.
Serve hot as a comforting soup.

name: Pad Thai
description: A popular Thai stir-fried noodle dish made with rice noodles, tofu or shrimp, and a mix of peanuts, bean sprouts, and flavorful sauces. It's a delicious and satisfying meal that brings together various textures and tastes.
steps: Soak rice noodles in warm water until soft.
In a pan, heat oil and add tofu, frying until golden.
Add shrimp to the pan and cook until pink.
Push ingredients to the side and crack an egg, scrambling it.
Add soaked noodles, chili sauce, and fish sauce, tossing to combine.
Top with crushed peanuts and bean sprouts.
Serve immediately with lime wedges.

name: Chili Chicken
description: This spicy chicken dish is stir-fried with chili powder, garlic, and ginger, creating a savory and aromatic flavor. It's often paired with rice or noodles for a hearty meal.
steps: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces and marinate with soy sauce.
Heat oil in a pan and add chopped garlic and ginger.
Add chicken to the pan and cook until browned.
Stir in chili powder and chopped onions.
Cook until the onions are soft and the chicken is cooked through.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Cucumber Salad with Chili
description: A refreshing salad made with crisp cucumbers, chili sauce, and garlic, providing a cool and spicy contrast. It's a perfect side dish for rich or spicy meals.
steps: Slice cucumbers thinly.
In a bowl, mix sliced cucumbers with chili sauce.
Add minced garlic and fish sauce, tossing to combine.
Chill in the refrigerator for a few minutes before serving.
Serve as a refreshing side dish.

name: Chicken in Sweet-Sour Sauce
description: Tender chicken cooked in a sweet and tangy sauce made with vinegar, garlic, and onions. This dish is both flavorful and satisfying, often served with rice.
imagePath: assets/images/Chicken in hot and sour sauce.png
steps: Cut chicken into strips and season with salt and pepper.
In a pan, heat oil and fry the chicken until golden.
Remove chicken and set aside.
In the same pan, add chopped garlic, onions, and chili.
Stir in vinegar, sugar, and return the chicken to the pan.
Cook until the sauce thickens and chicken is coated.
Serve with rice.

name: Mapo Tofu
description: A famous Chinese dish featuring silken tofu and minced pork in a spicy chili paste, flavored with garlic and Sichuan peppercorns. It's a spicy and fragrant dish that pairs well with rice.
steps: In a pan, heat oil and sauté minced garlic.
Add minced pork and cook until browned.
Stir in chili paste and soy sauce, cooking for a minute.
Add cubed tofu and gently mix to avoid breaking.
Sprinkle Sichuan peppercorn for a numbing flavor.
Simmer for 5-10 minutes, adding water if needed.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Noodles with Chili
description: A quick and flavorful dish of noodles tossed with chili sauce, garlic, and soy sauce. This dish is both satisfying and easy to prepare.
steps: Cook noodles according to package instructions and drain.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté garlic and ginger.
Add cooked noodles to the pan and toss.
Stir in chili sauce and soy sauce, mixing thoroughly.
Cook for another 2-3 minutes, adding water if needed.
Serve hot, garnished with green onions.

name: Beef Pho
description: A Vietnamese noodle soup made with beef, rice noodles, and aromatic spices. Served with fresh herbs and bean sprouts, this dish is hearty and full of flavor.
steps: In a large pot, simmer beef bones in water for broth.
Add spices like star anise and cloves for flavor.
Strain the broth and return it to the pot.
Cook rice noodles in a separate pot and drain.
Slice cooked beef and add to the broth.
Serve in bowls with noodles, bean sprouts, and basil.
Garnish with lime and chili slices.

name: Chicken Curry
description: A flavorful curry made with chicken, chili powder, and coconut milk, cooked with garlic and onions for a rich and comforting meal. Best served with rice.
steps: Cut chicken into pieces and season with salt.
In a pot, heat oil and sauté onions until golden.
Add garlic, ginger, and curry leaves, cooking until fragrant.
Stir in chili powder and add chicken, browning it.
Pour in coconut milk and let simmer until chicken is cooked.
Serve with rice or bread.

name: Rice with Curry
description: Simple yet delicious, this dish features rice cooked with curry powder and aromatic vegetables. It's a perfect side dish or base for your favorite curry.
steps: Cook rice according to package instructions.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté garlic and onions.
Add chili peppers and cook for a few minutes.
Stir in curry powder and add cooked rice, mixing well.
Cook for another 5 minutes, letting the flavors combine.
Serve hot as a side or main dish.

name: Banh Mi with Chili
description: A Vietnamese sandwich featuring a crispy baguette filled with pickled vegetables, chili sauce, and pork. It's a flavorful and satisfying meal on the go.
steps: Slice the baguette lengthwise but do not cut all the way through.
Fill the baguette with pickled vegetables and pork.
Spread chili sauce inside for heat.
Top with fresh cilantro before closing the sandwich.
Serve immediately as a quick meal.

name: Chinese Hotpot (Huoguo)
description: A communal dining experience featuring a simmering pot of broth in which various ingredients like beef and vegetables are cooked at the table, flavored with chili oil and Sichuan pepper for a spicy kick.
steps: Prepare the broth by boiling water with spices.
Arrange beef slices and vegetables on a platter.
Set up a hotpot on the table with the broth simmering.
Guests can cook their ingredients in the hot broth.
Serve with chili oil and soy sauce for dipping.
Enjoy the communal cooking experience.

name: Tom Sum Soup
description: A flavorful Thai soup that combines fresh seafood with fragrant herbs, delivering a perfect balance of spice and sourness.
steps: Bring a pot of water to a boil.
Add lemongrass and lime slices to the boiling water.
Allow the mixture to boil for about 5 minutes to infuse the flavors.
Add the seafood and chili to the pot.
Cook for another 5-7 minutes until the seafood is cooked through.
Taste the soup and adjust the seasoning with fish sauce as desired.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh lime wedges.

name: Beef with Chili
description: A spicy stir-fried dish featuring tender beef strips, cooked with aromatic garlic, onions, and chili paste for a flavorful meal.
steps: Heat a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add a tablespoon of oil to the hot pan.
Once the oil is hot, add the beef strips and stir-fry for about 3-4 minutes until browned.
Add minced garlic and sliced onions, cooking until the onions are translucent.
Stir in the chili paste and soy sauce, mixing well to coat the beef.
Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the beef is fully cooked and the flavors meld together.
Remove from heat and serve hot with rice or noodles.

name: Rajma
description: A comforting North Indian dish made with red kidney beans in a spiced tomato gravy, best served with rice or bread.
steps: Soak red kidney beans in water overnight or for at least 8 hours.
Drain and rinse the beans, then cook them in a pressure cooker with fresh water until soft.
In a separate pan, heat oil and add chopped onions, cooking until they turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic and chili powder, stirring for about a minute.
Mix in the cooked beans along with diced tomatoes, stirring to combine.
Simmer the mixture for 10-15 minutes, allowing the flavors to blend.
Serve hot with rice or bread.

name: Panang Curry
description: A rich and creamy Thai curry made with coconut milk, Panang curry paste, and tender chicken, flavored with fresh basil and chili.
steps: In a saucepan, heat coconut milk over medium heat until it begins to simmer.
Add Panang curry paste to the coconut milk, stirring to dissolve the paste.
Add chicken pieces and cook for about 10 minutes until they are cooked through.
Stir in sliced chili and fresh basil leaves.
Simmer for an additional 5 minutes to let the flavors meld.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed, then serve hot with rice.

name: Tom Kha Gai
description: A fragrant Thai coconut soup featuring chicken, galangal, and lemongrass, with a hint of chili and lime for a refreshing flavor.
steps: In a pot, bring coconut milk to a gentle boil over medium heat.
Add sliced galangal and lemongrass to the boiling coconut milk.
Let the mixture simmer for 5-10 minutes to infuse the flavors.
Add chicken pieces and cook until they are fully cooked through.
Stir in sliced chili and a splash of lime juice for flavor.
Simmer for another 5 minutes, then remove from heat.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

name: Sichuan Mustard
description: A simple and spicy side dish made with blanched mustard greens tossed in a fragrant garlic and chili oil dressing.
steps: Bring a pot of water to a boil.
Add mustard greens to the boiling water and blanch for 2-3 minutes.
Remove the greens and drain them in a colander.
In a bowl, mix garlic, chili oil, and Sichuan pepper.
Toss the blanched mustard greens in the mixture until well coated.
Serve immediately as a side dish or appetizer.

name: Dakbal
description: A spicy Korean dish made with chicken feet stir-fried in a savory chili sauce, perfect as a unique appetizer.
steps: Start by boiling chicken feet in a pot of water for about 10-15 minutes.
Drain the chicken feet and let them cool slightly.
In a pan, heat oil and add minced garlic, sautéing until fragrant.
Add chili paste and soy sauce to the pan, mixing well.
Toss in the boiled chicken feet and stir-fry for about 5 minutes.
Sprinkle sugar over the mixture and continue to cook until everything is well combined and heated through.
Serve hot, garnished with green onions if desired.

name: Tandoori Chicken
description: Marinated chicken roasted in a tandoor or oven, featuring a blend of yogurt and spices for a smoky and flavorful dish.
steps: In a bowl, mix yogurt, chili powder, minced garlic, and tandoori masala to create a marinade.
Coat the chicken pieces thoroughly with the marinade and let them marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight in the fridge.
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place the marinated chicken on a baking tray lined with foil.
Roast the chicken in the oven for about 25-30 minutes, turning halfway through for even cooking.
Check the internal temperature to ensure the chicken is fully cooked.
Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Spicy Fish Curry
description: A delicious fish curry made with fresh fish simmered in a spicy coconut milk sauce, perfect served with rice.
steps: Marinate fish pieces in curry powder and chili for about 15-20 minutes.
In a pan, heat oil over medium heat and add minced garlic.
Once the garlic is fragrant, add the marinated fish to the pan.
Cook the fish for about 5 minutes, turning gently to avoid breaking apart.
Pour in coconut milk and bring the mixture to a simmer.
Cook until the fish is tender and the sauce thickens slightly, about 10 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or bread.
